advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • advjava.assessment1.zuul.refactored.character.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonPlayerCharacter, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a superclass for any Characters in the game NonPlayerCharacter and Player both extend the functionality provided by the Character Class. Characters are given a weight, a declared MAX_WEIGHT, name, description, inventory (Comprised as a collection of Items) and their current room that they are allocated to. Methods are provided to alter non-constant information such as current room, inventory and weight.
    Author:
    dja33

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 Room room,
                 java.util.List<Item> items,
                 int maxWeight)
          throws InvalidCharacterNamingException
        Create a new character, called from subclasses takes a series of data regarding the player. Not all information has to be up to date. However name must NOT be null or an empty string otherwise an error will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Character
        description - The description of the Character
        room - The current room of the Character
        items - The items the Character is holding
        maxWeight - The maximum weight of the Character
        Throws:
        InvalidCharacterNamingException - If name is null or an empty String

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(int weight)
        Set the weight of the character, if a negative value set to 0, otherwise add weight to existing weight. If the weight exceeds the maximum weight then set weight to MAX_WEIGHT.
        Parameters:
        weight - The weight to add to weight
